meanings.definition: To make dirty with grime or soot.
meanings.sent1: She begrimmed her hands while cleaning the old fireplace.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic begrimmed his overalls while fixing the car engine.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy begrimmed its paws by playing in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The once pristine walls were begrimmed with layers of dust and dirt.
meanings.sent5: The neglected room was begrimmed with cobwebs and filth, a sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: The begrimmed windows obscured the view of the garden.
meanings.sent2: After a day of work, his face was begrimmed with sweat and dust.
meanings.sent3: The begrimmed old chimney looked like a mysterious tower in the fog.
meanings.sent4: The begrimmed walls of the tunnel seemed to absorb all light.
meanings.sent5: The begrimmed surface of the antique mirror reflected a distorted image.
